intro: Monnina ebracteata, commonly known as the slender monnina, is a low-growing annual herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped and slightly hairy. Its flowers are small, pink to reddish, and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Monnina ebracteata is adapted to thrive in poor soils and can often be found in disturbed areas like roadsides and sandy soils.
